report_title: Hot Tub Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Solid construction activity and increased disposable income over most of the five years to 2023 have resulted in rising revenue for hot tub manufacturers. Since hot tubs and spas are highly discretionary luxury goods, demand primarily depends on consumer confidence and per capita disposable income. Rising disposable income is significant for the industry, particularly as households wishing to remodel their existing homes remain the largest market for hot tubs and whirlpool baths.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 Created a Surge in Demand for Hot Tubs
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During COVID-19, many people spent more time at home and looked for ways to create a relaxing and enjoyable environment in their backyard. Hot tubs offered a convenient and affordable way to do this and became increasingly popular.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Construction Activity Stimulates Demand for Whirlpool Baths
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: People often install whirlpool baths in their homes for various reasons, including relaxation, stress relief and physical therapy. Higher interest rates make it more expensive for consumers to borrow money, resulting in a slowdown in the housing market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Product Innovation Will Remain at the Crux of Manufacturers' Success
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Many hot tub manufacturers are incorporating smart technology into their products, allowing users to control their hot tubs remotely using their smartphones or other devices. This trend is expected to continue, with more advanced and sophisticated smart features introduced.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Economic Trends, Changing Consumer Preferences and Industry Innovation Will Shape Commercial Use of Hot Tubs
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumers increasingly seek wellness features in their hot tubs. This trend will likely extend to commercial hot tub use, with more consumers seeking out commercial hot tubs that offer hydrotherapy and other wellness features.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Home-based Leisure Activities Remain Popular but Recede From COVID-19-Prompted Highs
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: After emerging as a necessity during COVID-19, home-based leisure activities are estimated to become less popular over the five years to 2028. Pent-up demand for travel, social events and activities outside the home are anticipated to decrease consumers' time spent at home.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures hot tubs, spas and whirlpools made from nonceramic materials (e.g. fiberglass or acrylic). A hot tub is a large tub or small pool full of heated water that is used for soaking, relaxation, massages or hydrotherapy. In most cases, they have jets for massage purposes.

negative_impact_factors: Price of plastic materials and resin

key_trends: One of the most obvious ways hot tub manufacturers compete is on price. Companies may offer discounts, promotions, or special financing options to make their products more affordable for customers.
The reputation of a brand can be an important factor for customers when choosing a hot tub. Companies may compete on their reputation for quality, reliability, or customer satisfaction.

Consumers are increasingly looking for eco-friendly, energy-efficient hot tubs that can help them save money on their energy bills. As a result, hot tub manufacturers are investing in energy-efficient technologies like insulated covers, high-efficiency pumps, and LED lighting.

During COVID-19, many people spent more time at home and looked for ways to enjoy home-based leisure activities. Hot tubs offered a convenient and affordable way to do this and became increasingly popular.

Cal Spas, which is now owned by Trilantic North America, produces a range of hot tubs, swim spas, and other outdoor leisure products. Their hot tubs are known for their quality construction, energy efficiency, and advanced features, such as built-in sound systems, LED lighting, and massage jets.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The residential market includes hot tub sales to the residential remodeling and new residential construction markets. Manufacturers derive most revenue from the single-family housing market, including portable aboveground and inground hot tub installations, maintenance, and repair activities. Demand for hot tubs from the residential market spiked during COVID-19 as consumers increasingly assembled at home and sought safe methods to destress. Rising disposable income levels enabled consumers to purchase high-end hot tub models, boosting industry revenue.

The commercial sector includes fitness centers, therapeutic offices, resorts, and other recreational facilities. The onset of COVID-19 forced many fitness centers, resorts, and recreational centers to close temporarily, resulting in a contraction in demand for hot tubs from the commercial market. Many hotels and resorts offer hot tubs as an amenity for their guests. Hot tubs are popular among travelers because they provide relaxation and comfort after a long day of activities. Hot tubs are used in health and fitness facilities, like spas, gyms, and rehabilitation centers. They are used for hydrotherapy, which involves water relieving pain and improving mobility.

products_and_services.product_description: Hot Tubs are a Popular Choice for Those Looking for Relaxation and Stress Relief
Fiberglass and Other Whirlpool Baths Offer a Luxurious and Therapeutic Bathing Experience

demand_determinants.determinant_description: According to the Association of Pool and Spa Professionals, households earning over $100,000 are the primary market for hot tub manufacturers. Higher-income families are more willing to purchase luxury goods like hot tubs. As higher-income households grow, demand for hot tubs and spas increases. The number of households earning more than $100,000 is expected to increase in 2023, representing a potential opportunity for the industry.

Whirlpool baths come in various shapes, colors and sizes since consumers install them inside their homes and may be interested in a specific design to fit their style. During COVID-19, rising disposable income and increased time spent inside the home increased private spending on home improvements, including upgrading their bath options to incorporate fiberglass and other whirlpool baths.

international_trade_points.trade_title: High Shipping Costs and Regulatory Requirements Limit Imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: Hot tubs are large and heavy, which makes them expensive to transport over long distances. Shipping costs can be a significant portion of a hot tub's total cost, making it difficult for foreign manufacturers to compete with domestic manufacturers with lower transportation costs. Hot tubs sold in the US must meet particular safety and quality standards set by federal and state regulatory agencies. These requirements can vary by state and be difficult and expensive for foreign manufacturers to comply with.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Chinese Hot Tubs are Popular with Consumers, but Concerns Limit Greater Chinese Penetration into the Domestic Market
international_trade_points.trade_description: Some hot tubs from China are well-regarded for their quality, features, and affordability, and these products can be competitive with domestic hot tubs in terms of price and features. Recently, there have been some concerns about the quality and safety of certain products made in China, including hot tubs.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Price Provides a Barrier to Greater Export Levels
international_trade_points.trade_description: Hot tubs tend to be low-volume, high-value items requiring special packaging and transportation procedures. The heavyweight of hot tubs makes shipping costs outweigh the benefit of hot tubs manufactured in the United States for international consumers. US hot tubs can be more expensive than those made in other countries, making them less attractive to cost-conscious consumers.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Proximity to US Trade Ports Influences Export Destinations
international_trade_points.trade_description: The small trade mainly occurs with China and Canada, the top export markets, because of their proximity to main US trade ports and trade agreements that fuel this trend. US hot tub manufacturers are often at the forefront of innovation and technology and may offer advanced features not available in hot tubs made in China and Canada.

business_locations.location_description: Climate, Supply Chain, Labor Costs and Industry Expertise Make the West a Popular Location for Many Hot Tub Manufacturers. The western region of the US, especially California, Arizona, and Nevada, have a warm and dry climate ideal for outdoor activities, including hot tubs. Many hot tub manufacturers are located close to their suppliers, who may also be located in the western part of the country. Some western states, like Nevada, have lower labor costs than other parts of the country, making it more cost-effective for hot tub manufacturers to locate their facilities in these areas. Several of the largest hot tub manufacturers in the world, like Jacuzzi and Cal Spas, are headquartered in California.

Access to Transportation, Climate, and Proximity to Customers Benefit Manufacturers in the Southeast. The southeast region has a robust transportation infrastructure, including major ports and highways, which makes it easier for manufacturers to import materials and export finished products. The southeast region has a large pool of skilled labor, including workers with experience in manufacturing and engineering. While the southeast region is known for its hot and humid summers, it also experiences mild winters that are ideal for using hot tubs. The southeast region has a large population, including many affluent consumers who may be interested in purchasing hot tubs.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Regulations cover air and water emissions, industrial zoning, occupational health and safety regulations, and the minimum product design quality.

Environmental restrictions can impact manufacturers, most notably regulations governing the minimum permittable emission of kiln dust. Additionally, hot tubs are often subject to additional state and local government regulations concerning potential environmental damage created during the manufacturing process.

basis_points.basis_description: One of the most obvious ways hot tub manufacturers compete is on price. Companies may offer discounts, promotions, or special financing options to make their products more affordable for customers.
The reputation of a brand can be an important factor for customers when choosing a hot tub. Companies may compete on their reputation for quality, reliability, or customer satisfaction.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Jacuzzi Brands LLC and Masco Corporation (Masco) currently dominate the domestic market, competing with several smaller regional and local manufacturers.
Market share concentration has increased over the five years to 2023 because of significant acquisition activity and smaller manufacturers choosing to leave the market.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rising Input Costs Push Purchase Costs Higher
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Similar to other manufacturing industries, purchases are the primary costs for manufacturers. Hot tubs and spas are manufactured from fiberglass, acrylic resin, wood, concrete and plastic. Over the past five years, purchase costs have increased with rising plastic and resin prices.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Consumer Sentiment and Disposable Income Levels
volatility_points.volatility_description: Given that hot tubs and spas are luxury goods for most consumers, demand for hot tubs is highly dependent on consumer sentiment and disposable income levels. Broader macroeconomic trends, like residential construction activity and mortgage rates also influence volatility.

volatility_points.volatility_title: COVID-19 Introduced Greater Volatility to the Industry
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for hot tubs spiked significantly during COVID-19, as people spent more time at home and looked for ways to relax and entertain themselves while social distancing.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Some hot tubs now use saltwater systems instead of traditional chlorine-based systems. These systems use a small amount of salt to generate chlorine, which keeps the water clean and sanitized. Saltwater can be gentler on the skin and eyes than traditional chlorine.

Hot tub jets have also become more advanced in recent years, with some models featuring adjustable jets that can be customized to target specific areas of the body. Some hot tubs also feature air jets, which create a gentle massage sensation.

FAQs.question: How will your company be affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Imports represent a substantial threat to domestic hot tub manufacturers, as many foreign brands offer similar products for lower prices. Certain international regions can produce hot tubs at much lower prices than domestic manufacturers, so competing based on price is often futile; producers can invest in quality materials and highly skilled engineers to manufacture superior products and stand out from the pack.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Larger operators manufacture a wide range of products, including outdoor hot tubs and whirlpool baths. Small operators tend to focus on a specific type of product, catering to a specific niche. The more diversification there is, the larger the potential consumer base, which bodes well for operators looking to expand their quantity of consumers.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in research and development to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Companies compete significantly based on the design, style and color options they offer. Companies also compete based on technology, based on things such as the quality and power of water jets. By investing in research & development, a company could simultaneously drive growth in emerging products while also keeping tabs on shifting consumer preferences as it relates to current products in the market.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities?
FAQs.answer: Market share concentration has increased due to significant acquisition activity among larger operators and dozens of smaller manufacturers being forced out of the market.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Technological developments in automation technology will cause demand for labor to decline.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to safeguard your company's proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: Competition is often based on the technical properties and perceived quality of the product. US manufacturers' brand names and reputation for providing quality hot tubs offer them a competitive advantage in the domestic market that foreign manufacturers typically lack.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Hot tub manufacturers operate under a low degree of regulatory control, but are still required to abide by occupational health and safety regulations.

FAQs.question: Is your company adequately prepared to comply with new environmental standards?
FAQs.answer: Environmental restrictions can affect this industry, most notably regulations governing the minimum allowable emission of kiln dust.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare with your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Larger industry companies benefit from economies of scale and often operate with higher profit margins than smaller competitors.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for the seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Sales of hot tubs, specifically outdoor products, can vary based on the season. In ground hot tubs cannot be installed properly if the ground is too wet, such as when it may be covered in snow in the winter. Seasonal sales and holidays are another opportunity for a company to produce extra cash flow, since consumers will be more inclined to spend money during holiday sales or warmer weather.

FAQs.question: What strategies do you have in place to contain costs between your facilities? Do you own any wholesale or retail operations?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies face lower operating costs due to economies of scale, which results in higher profits.

FAQs.question: If there is economic uncertainty that threatens price stability, it's important for a company to be able to control its operating costs to keep profit margins steady.
Has your company been able to integrate technology into your business to lower labor costs? Ability to reduce labor costs
FAQs.answer: Companies that can successfully integrate technology to lower labor costs have a competitive advantage. A low dependence on labor enables companies to quickly scale down operations when demand is low. By efficiently integrating technology into the workplace, a company could lower its operating costs, with the new technology providing an opportunity for increased efficiency within certain operational tasks.

FAQs.question: What downstream ownership links does your company currently have? Is your company pursuing any other ownership links?
FAQs.answer: Downstream hot tub distributors and retailers charge considerable mark-ups for hot tubs. Manufacturers that control their own distribution network can experience higher profit by removing the retailer's cut from the final price of hot tubs. By controlling distribution networks, a company can lower its marginal costs during the production process and avoid processing issues within the broader supply chain.

FAQs.question: How do changes in plastic prices affect your margins? Are you able to pass on cost increases to your buyers?
FAQs.answer: When the price of plastic increases, hot tub manufacturers experience higher material costs, which cuts into profit. By passing those excess costs onto consumers, a company could increase its profit margin and withstand price volatility of raw goods such as plastic materials.

FAQs.question: How quickly do your sales change based on trends in disposable income? Do you market your products differently when the economy is strong?
FAQs.answer: When household disposable income is high, consumers are more willing to splurge on hot tubs and spas for their homes. If a company can maximize marketing efficiency during economic downturns, it can raise its profit margins while also bolstering revenue by focusing on key consumer demographics, such as households with incomes over $100,000.

FAQs.question: How many of your customers are homeowners? Do you plan on increasing marketing to better appeal to homeowners?
FAQs.answer: Hot tubs are relatively long-term purchases for consumers, and as private spending on home improvements increases, it is more likely that this kind of spending will include individuals purchasing new hot tubs. If private spending on home improvements stagnates, it might not make sense for a company to market its goods towards homeowners, with potentially better alternatives available in the commercial sector instead.
